result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Budych was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with Jodi Gray. Comply with all orders of the Juvenile Court in CHIPS case #14JC98 relating to C.B.
---------------------------

**04/17/2015 AMENDMENT:  The Defendant was convicted of a misdemeanor with a violation date prior to April 1, 2015.  HE IS NOT REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A DNA SAMPLE.  He is still required to pay the DNA surcharge however.  ---------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
---------------------------
